intro: Parakeelya eremaea, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique flowering plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It is characterized by its striking, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer, often appearing as if they are floating in the air. The plant has a compact, low-growing habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. Its flowers are tubular and have a distinctive, almost translucent appearance, which gives it its common name. Parakeelya eremaea is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions, making it a rare and resilient species in its native habitat.
